あの辺り――
ずいぶんと子供が多いようだな？
column4:
In that area―― 
It looks like there are a lot of children, 
doesn't it?

column3:
あ？　ああ――
みんな戦争で親とはぐれたり、失ったりで
身を寄せ合って暮らしてるのさ
column4:
What? Oh―― 
They've lost their parents or been separated from 
them because of the war, 
so they're sticking together.

column3:
お前が衝動的に、俺達を追い剥ぎしようと
尾行したあの時も――傍に子供がいたみたいだな
column4:
When you followed us impulsively to rob us, 
it seems there were children nearby as well.

column3:
あの辺りは毎日彼らが見回りをしているそうだ
――もちろん知っているな？
column4:
Apparently, 
they keep watch over that area every day—
I'm sure you know that, right?

column3:
その子は、お前の顔を見たことがあるそうだ
しかも、何度も――な
column4:
That kid has seen your face before.
And more than once--yeah.

column3:
その子の話によると、お前――
コソコソしながらずいぶんと熱心に
何かを書き付けていたそうじゃないか
column4:
According to the boy, you--
were sneaking around and writing
something down with a lot of enthusiasm!

column3:
お前――
「字も書けなきゃ宿も無い」んじゃなかったのか？
column4:
You--
I thought you said "no writing skills, no home"?
Ugh --!

column3:
あの日も、お前が物陰でせっせと
メモしていた姿を目撃したそうだ
column4:
That day, too, it seems that they saw you busily 
taking notes in the shadows.

column3:
ずいぶんと――
"用意周到な追い剥ぎ" だな？
column4: Seems like you're a "well-prepared mugger," huh?

column3:
ここまで《証拠》は揃っているんだ
いい加減に――――
column4:
Evidence has been gathered up to this point. 
It's about time to――――

――――
―――――Huhahaha!

column3: なっ――！
column4: What—!

column3:
それで勝ったつもりか？
バカバカしい！
column4:
And you think you've won?
That's ridiculous!

column3:
《証拠》なんて物で追い詰めたつもりだろうが――
憲兵の取り調べごっこはもう終わりだ！
column4:
You thought you could corner me with this 
"evidence," but―― 
The charade of the 
Military Police interrogation is finished!

column3:
俺がお前たちを尾行してメモしていたって？
それを子供が見ていたって？
――それを確固たる《証拠》だと言い張るのか？
column4:
I was following you guys and taking notes?
A kid was watching it?
— Are you arguing that's solid "proof"?

column3:
子供がなんと言おうと、身体検査された時に
そのメモが出てこなかった――
column4:
Even if the child says otherwise, 
that note wasn't found during the body check.

column3:
それこそが動かぬ事実だ
そうだろう、覚者さんよぉ――
column4:
That is the irrefutable truth. 
Isn't that so, Arisen--

column3:
――やれやれ
"<NPC 691>が書いていたメモ"――
その現物を見せるまで一歩も譲らないつもりか
column4:
--Well then. 
Are you set on not giving in until you see the 
actual note written by <NPC 691>?

column3:
覚者、この勝ち誇った腹立たしいツラに

column4:
Arisen, let's shove that note into 
this smug, infuriating face.

column4:
That note you're talking about--
Could you possibly be talking about this 
dirty stack of papers?

column3:
字が汚くて読みづらいが――どうやら
覚者がとった行動が事細かに書かれているようだな
column4:
The writing is sloppy and difficult to decipher, 
but it appears to describe the Arisen's actions 
in meticulous detail.

column3: い、いったい――
column4: What the hell--

column4: Where the hell did you get it?

上手く隠したつもりかもしれないが――
子供ってのは、見つけちゃいけないものを
うっかり掘り返す天才なのさ
column4:
You may think you've hidden it well--
Kids are geniuses at accidentally digging
up things they shouldn't find.

column3: くそ――くそ！！
column4: Damn -- damn it!

尾行メモの存在によって判明したな

Well--we know that this guy was following us and 
probing our activities because of the existence of
the tailing notes.

column3:

内容が隙を突くことに特化しすぎている

column4:
However, it's too focused on exploiting 
vulnerabilities to be merely that of an 
enthusiastic fan. 

It's almost as if they're aiming for 
assassination.

column3:
やったな、新しい情報を入手したぞ
やはり、この男の背後には
大きな影が動いているようだ
column4:
Well done, we've acquired new information. 
It appears that a significant force is at work 
behind this man.

俺はそれが――<NPC 681>だという確信がある

column4:
I'm reasonably sure it's <NPC 681>,
but the evidence is still weak.

column3:

必ずヤツの尻尾を掴んでやる！
column4:
Let's resume the interrogation. 
We're going to get to the bottom of this!

column3:

判明したな
column4:
The memo written by <NPC 691> reveals that we 
were tracked on several occasions.

column3:
だがその動機――
そしてこいつがただのゴロツキでないのなら
一体何者か、それはまだ謎のままだ
column4:
But the motive--
and if this guy isn't just a thug,
who the hell is he? 

That remains a mystery.

column3:
初めての尋問にしては良い調子だぞ
その調子で、さらなる情報を引き出すんだ
column4:
This is a good start for a first interrogation. 
Keep this pace to get more information.

そろそろ、お前の正体を

Isn't it about time 
you tell me who you really are?

I'm a genuine drifter.

column4: Totally useless—no progress at all.

column4:

column4:

Concrete "proof" of my true identity――

I'm not saying another word 
unless you show that to me.

column3:

覚者、今持っている《証拠》をもう一度

column4:
Good grief―― 
Even though you're tied up, 
you're quite confident. 

Arisen, take another close look 
at the "evidence" you have.

Yeah, that's it! 
I was a fool of a Military Police officer who got 
caught by the target during a covert mission!

ordered by <NPC 681> to follow us?

俺は上官から命令を受けて動いているだけだ
誰が元締めだかなんて、興味ねえよ
column4:
It's not my concern.
I'm just following the orders I was given.
Who's actually in charge doesn't matter to me.

column3:
それよりも、だ――
本当にマズいのはお前らの方だぞ
column4:
More importantly, though—
You're the ones who are really in trouble.

column3: ――どういう意味だ？
column4: --What do you mean?

column3:
憲兵を捕まえて、監禁と尋問なんか――
イタズラで済むような内容じゃないぜ
column4:
Capturing a military police officer, 
locking him up and interrogating him--
This isn't just some prank.

column3: ハッ、そんな脅しでいまさら怖がると思うのか？
column4: Ha, you think such threats will scare me now?

column3:
いいや、それだけじゃない
お前ら――侯爵様に楯突いているとかいう
レジスタンスだろ？
column4:
That's not the whole story.
You're—
resistance members who are opposing 
the Marquis, aren't you?

column3:
このメガドを護っているのは
侯爵様や、俺たち憲兵隊――それが常識だ
column4:
It's understood that the marquis and our 
military police are the ones protecting Megado.

column3:
もし口封じに俺を殺しでもしてみろ
死体が上がれば犯人はお前たちだとすぐに分かる
column4:
If you kill me to cover this up, it will be clear 
that you're the ones responsible as soon as 
my body is discovered.

column3:
そうなれば、レジスタンスは市民の敵と化すだろう
オーク騒ぎがやっと落ち着いた後での、すぐだ
気の立った市民たちはどうすると思う？
column4:
If that happens, the resistance will become the 
enemy of the people. 
It will be right after the orc disturbances 
finally settle down. 

What do you think the angry citizens will do?

column3:
――レジスタンス狩りが始まるだろうな
無駄な血が流れることになるぜ、お前らのせいでな
column4:
--The resistance hunt will start.
There will be a lot of unnecessary bloodshed, 
because of you guys.

column3: 勝手なこと言いやがるぜ
column4: You're talking nonsense.

column3:
だが怪我をしたのはこちらだけじゃない――
コイツも、下手を打って俺たちに囚われているという
ボロを出してるんだ
column4:
But it's not just us who are hurt—
he's also shown his weakness by getting 
captured by us.

column3:
さぁ、調子に乗っているその口に
《証拠》をねじ込んでやれ
column4:
Now, 
shove that evidence right into his cocky mouth.

column3:
自分の状況を思い出し――
行く末に震え上がる、決定的な《証拠》をな！
column4:
Think about your own situation —
the conclusive evidence that leaves you 
quaking about what's to come!

column4: Threaten

Hmph, what's with that pile of filthy papers? 
Are you trying to beg for mercy with that?

column3:
これは、元は憲兵として活躍していた男が
獄中で書いた手記だ
column4:
This is a diary written by a former 
military police officer during his time in prison.
What----

column3:
そ、それがなんだってんだよ
騎士だろうが憲兵だろうが全員が善人って訳じゃねえ
column4:
Well, so what?
Whether you're a knight or a 
military police officer, 
not all of us are good guys.

column3:
――いいやこの男は善人だった
ただ少し、任務に失敗しちまったんだ
column4:
No, this man was a good person. 
He just failed a mission.

column3:
よく聞けよ、<NPC 691>
手が使えないお前の為に読み上げてやる
column4:
Listen carefully,<NPC 691>.
I'll read it aloud for you 
since your hands are bound.

column3:
"それからすぐ同僚の憲兵たちが家に押しかけてきた
  昨日まで背中を預けた相手に縛り上げられるなんて
  一体誰が予想できる？"
column4:
"Soon after, my fellow military police officers 
came barging into my home. 
Who could have predicted being bound by those 
I trusted just yesterday?"

column3:
"獄中の暮らしは、外界から完全に断絶されていて
  残してきた病気のお袋が心配だ"
column4:
"In prison, there's a complete disconnection from 
the outside, and I'm anxious about my sick 
mother whom I left behind."

column3:
"ネド王子の安否は？　オーク軍はどうなった？
  くそ、あんな小さなミス一つでこんな仕打ち！
  もう許せない、俺は出るぞ" ――
column4:
"What about Prince Nedo's safety? 
What happened to the Orc army? 
Damn it, 
to be treated like this over such a small mistake!
 I can't forgive this—I'm getting out of here!"

column3:
奴は脱獄した後、憲兵からの追跡に耐え切れず
この手記を俺たちに手渡してすぐ絶命した
column4:
After he escaped from prison, 
he couldn't withstand being chased by the 
military police and died right after handing over 
this note to us.

column3:
さて――お前は今、任務に失敗して敵に捕らえられ
あまつさえ秘匿情報も漏らしている
column4:
Now then-- 
you've failed your mission, 
been captured by the enemy, 
and even leaked confidential information.

column3:
本当に許しを請うべきなのはどちらか――
わかるな？
column4:
You should understand which of us 
should truly be asking for forgiveness.
Ugh, uh--

column3:
そう落ち込むな
お前にはひとつ、道がある
column4:
Don't be so depressed.
There is a single path for you.

column3:
俺たちに協力し、知る情報を全て提供してくれ
そうすれば身の安全か逃げ道か――
望むものを与えてやる
column4:
Help us and give us all the information you know
and we'll give you either 
personal safety or a way out--
whatever you want.

column3:
お、俺に憲兵隊と侯爵様を裏切って
レジスタンスに入れって言うのか？
column4:
Oh, you want me to betray 
the Military Police and the Marquis
and join the resistance?

column3:
おかしいとは思わないか？
オークの脅威が去って、平和になったはずの街で
今度は憲兵の横暴に脅かされている――
column4:
Don't you think it's strange?
A city that was supposed to be at peace after the 
orc threat was over is now threatened by the 
brutality of the military police--

column3: ――無理だ
column4: I--I can't.

column3:
諸悪の根源である侯爵――
<NPC 681>を打ち倒してこそ真の平和が訪れる
そうは思わないか
column4:
True peace will come only when the root of all evil, the Marquis--
<NPC 681> is defeated.
Don't you think so?

column3:
――何と言われようと無理なものは無理だ
投獄だろうと処刑だろうと甘んじて受け入れる
column4:
No matter what they say, the impossible is impossible.
I'll accept whatever it is - be it prison or execution.

column3:
くそ！
一体何が、ヤツをここまで頑なにさせる！？
column4:
Damn!
What the hell is making him so stubborn?

column3:
コイツは間もなく堕ちる――
あと一押し、何か《証拠》は無いのか！
column4:
This guy is going to give up shortly...
One more push, is there any more evidence we can use?

ある老人から預かったものだ
彼は息子を亡くしたと話していた
column4:
I got this from an old man;
he told me he lost his son.

連絡が取れなくなったため、殉職したものと

After sending out his son, who he raised himself, to the military police;
he lost contact and assumed his son was killed in the line of duty.

なぜ連絡してやらない？

Why didn't you contact him?

column3:
家族と連絡を取れば、危険が及ぶからと――
上官に忠告を受けて――
column4:
My superiors told me not to contact my family 
because it might put them in danger...

column3:
なるほど、そうやって反乱の芽を
摘みやすい環境を作っている訳だな
繋がりを絶たせておけば、切り捨てるのも容易――
column4:
I see, that's how they make it easier to nip rebellion in the bud.
It's easier to eliminate them if you keep them disconnected from others.

column3:
<NPC 691>――頼む

column4:

for the sake of you and your father;

because any rebellious attitudes and suspicious behavior are subject to
enforcement.

Knowing that,
why were you a part of it?

column3:
実は――
金が良いんだわ、これが
column4:
As a matter of fact...
The pay is good - it really is.

column3:
まぁ、稀に今回のような息の詰まる
特別任務が与えられることもあるが――
column4:
Well, in rare cases, you'll be given a breathtaking
special mission like this one...

column3:
良い給料で、市民に大きな顔できる上
オークとも戦わなくて済む
――最高の仕事だろ？
column4:
A good salary, a big impression on the citizens
and not having to fight against orcs
— best job ever, right?

column3: オークと戦わなくて済む――だと？
column4: You don't have to fight against orcs?

column3:
"オークとの戦闘は、王国兵士に任せておけ
  憲兵隊は、人間の相手をするのが仕事"
――ってことらしい
column4:
"Leave the orc fighting to the soldiers of the kingdom.
The Military Police are supposed to deal with humans."
That's what they said.

column3: ま、俺が知っているのはこれくらいかな――
column4: Well, I think that's all I know.

column3: ナヴィド・クルト侯爵ねぇ――
column4: Kurt Navid, the Marquis, huh...

column3:
一応憲兵隊の指揮権を持ってるって話だけど
俺らみたいな下っ端じゃ
そうそうお目にかかれないぜ
column4:
He supposedly has command over 
the military police, 
but someone like us low-ranking folks won't get 
to see him very often.

column3:
むしろ覚者さん
あんたの方が詳しいんじゃないのかい？
column4: In fact, aren't you more familiar with it, Arisen?

column3: ――コイツ、昼まで監視してやがった
column4: --This guy kept watch until midday.

column3:
へへ――あぁ、そうそう！
憲兵隊を創設したのは<NPC 681>様だったな
column4:
Heh—oh, that's right! 
<NPC 681> was the one who 
created the Military Police.

column3:
先代侯爵が亡くなって、爵位を継いだ<NPC 681>様が
他にもいろいろ整備したって話だな
詳しくは忘れちまったけど――
column4:
After the previous marquis passed away, 
<NPC 681> inherited the title and 
apparently made various improvements. 

I don't remember the details, though—

column3:
まぁ、なんだかんだでメガドがここまで
発展してきたのは、<NPC 681>様の功績も
大きいって訳よ
column4:
Ultimately, <NPC 681>'s accomplishments are 
a major reason for how far Megado has come.

column3:
おいおい、そんな怖い顔すんなって！
俺が知っているのはこれくらいだな
column4:
Hey hey, don't make such a scary face!
That's all I know.

column3:
レジスタンスぅ？
そうだなぁ――
column4:
The Resistance?
Yeah, well...

column3:
メフィスさん、あんたはバッチリ指名手配に
なってるぜ
だが――
column4: Mephis, you're on the wanted list for sure. But—

column3:
俺の知る限り、レジスタンスを大々的に
どうこうするって話はまだ聞いてねえなあ
column4:
As far as I know, I haven't heard any major 
plans to deal with the resistance yet.

column3:
まだ、そこまで危険視は
されていないということか？
column4:
So, the resistance isn't 
considered a major threat yet?

column3:
だな
まぁそもそも、レジスタンスについて
侯爵側の持っている情報が少なすぎるってのもある
column4:
Yes.
Well, to begin with, there is too little 
information about the Resistance 
on the Marquis's side.

column3:
――あるいは、全て筒抜けだからこそ
軽んじられているのか――
column4:
--Or maybe it's being downplayed precisely 
because everything is leaked?

column3:
いずれにせよ、侯爵様のご関心はレジスタンスより
覚者さん――あんたにあるようだぜ
column4:
In any case, the Marquis seems to be interested in
the Arisen rather than the Resistance -- you

column3: 結局、今回お前に与えられていた任務は何なんだ？
column4:
After all, what was the mission you were 
given this time around?

column3:
そりゃあもちろん、覚者さんの尾行・行動監視だ
それを逐一メモして、上官に提出する
column4:
Well, of course, it's tracking and 
behavior monitoring on the Arisen.
Write it down one by one and submit it.

column3: 一体指令は誰が出している？
column4: Who issued the directive?

column3:
直接の伝令は上官からだよ
で、任務についての詳しい質問や詮索は
許可されていない
column4:
The orders are given by the superior officer. 
Detailed questions or probing about the 
mission are not allowed.

column3:
だが噂では――指揮しているのは
侯爵家の家令、<NPC 586>さんだとか
column4:
But according to rumors, the one in command is 
<NPC 586>, 
the steward of the marquis' household.

column3:
<NPC 586>――か
覚者、お前は顔を見たことがあるかもしれんな
column4:
<NPC 586>... I see. 
Arisen, you might recognize their face.

column3:
まぁ、あくまで噂だぜ
<NPC 586>さんが独断で指揮しているのか
さらに上から命令を受けているのかは定かじゃない
column4:
Well, it's just a rumor. 
I'm not sure if <NPC 586> is directing this 
on his own or if he's taking orders from
further up the chain.

column3: あぁ、分かっている
column4: Ah, I know.

column3:
とにかくこれは有用な情報だぞ、覚者！
この先は<NPC 586>とかいう侯爵家の家令が
鍵となりそうだな――
column4:
In any case, this information is 
quite useful, Arisen! 
The steward of the Marquis, 
<NPC 586>, 
seems to be the key moving forward.

column3:
――これで、俺が知っていることは
全て話したぞ
column4:
--That's it.
I've told you everything I know.

column3:
――覚者、次のターゲットは<NPC 586>だ
次回<NPC 681>の屋敷へ行くときには
それとなく身辺を探ってくれ
column4:
Arisen, the next target is <NPC 586>. 
When you head to 
<NPC 681>'s estate next time, 
subtly investigate the surroundings.

column3:
なぁ、他に道も無いんだし
最後までレジスタンスに付き合うからさぁ――
column4:
Look, there's no turning back now, 
so I'll see this through with the Resistance.

column3: そろそろ解いてくれねえか？
column4: Isn't it about time you untied me?

column3:
――ヤツもこう言っていることだし
そろそろこの尋問を終えようか
column4:
――Given what he's said, 
we should bring this interrogation to a close.

column3:
フフ――正直、お前がここまでやるとは予想外だ
よく頑張ったな、覚者
column4:
Huh - honestly, 
I didn't expect you to make it this far.
Good job, Arisen!

column3:
<NPC 691>を落とせたのはお前の力だ
次もよろしく頼むぞ、相棒――
column4:
It was your skill that took down <NPC 691>. 
Let's work together again, partner.

column3:
おい！　
自分がどういう状況か分かっているのか！？
column4:
Hey! 
Are you aware of the trouble you're in right now!?

column3:
おい、急になんだよ！
ただのゴロツキだって言ってるだろ！
column4:
Hey, what's going on!? 
I've already said, I'm just a lowlife!

column3:
そうか、ならばそれを証明できる
人物はいるんだな？
column4:
Well, then there's a
person who can prove it, right?

column3:
あ、あぁ――！
もちろんだ！
column4:
Oh, ah--!
Of course!

column3:
覚者、ゴロツキの身分を証明できるという
人物を探してみよう
あるいは――証明できないという証明でもいい
column4:
Arisen, let's try to find someone who can vouch 
for this thug's identity. 
Or perhaps, proof that they 
can't back up his story will suffice.

column3:
おい、いい加減にしろ！
一体どういうつもりで尾行した！？
column4:
Hey, come on!
What the hell were you thinking following me?

column3:
わっ――なんだよ驚かすな
衝動的な追い剥ぎだって言ってるだろ
column4:
Hey—what's going on? 
I told you, 
I'm just a spur-of-the-moment bandit!

column3:
衝動的な、か――
ならば、衝動的じゃない《証拠》があれば
認めるんだな？
column4:
Impulsive, huh--
So if we have "proof" that it's not impulsive,
you'll admit it?

column3: ハッ、そんなもんある訳ないだろ
column4: Ha, there's no such thing.

column3:
奴が本当に尾行していたなら、付近の地形や
俺たちの行動を事前調査していたはず
――目撃者がいてもおかしくないな
column4:
If he was really following us, 
he would have surveyed the nearby terrain and
our movements in advance.
--I wouldn't be surprised if there were witnesses.

column3:
俺達の尾行時につけていたメモを出してみろ
だと――？
column4:
You want me to hand over the notes I took 
while tailing you—huh?

column3:
どこにあるかお前が一番よく知ってんだろうが！
隠したんだろう？
場所を言え！！
column4:
You know best where it is!
You hid it, didn't you?
Tell me where it is!

column3:
し、知らねえよ！
そもそもあんな、何もない場所で隠しても
すぐに見つかっちまうだろうが！
column4:
I-I don't know! 
Hiding something in a place like that, 
it'd be found right away!

column3:
――覚者、<NPC 691>は確保されるまで
確実にそのメモを持っていたはずだ
捕まる瞬間に捨てたか隠したか――
column4:
Arisen, <NPC 691> must have had that note 
until they were captured. 
They either threw it away or hid it at the 
moment of their capture.

column3:
いずれにせよ、現場から離れていないはずだ
奴を捕まえたのは俺たちの集会所にほど近い路地――
覚者、行ってみよう
column4:
—In any case, it shouldn't be far from the scene. 
The alley where we captured them is quite close 
to our meeting place. Let's head over, Arisen.

column3:
おい、いい加減時間稼ぎは止めろ！
痛めつけられたいのか？
column4:
Hey, come on, stop stalling!
You want to get hurt?

column3:
な、何か他の《証拠》でもあるってのか！？
不気味なメモ一つで、俺が何か企んでるなんて
あんまりじゃねえか！
column4:
—Do you have any other "evidence" 
to back this up?! 
It's outrageous to think I'm planning something 
based on just one strange note!

column3:
少し外で頭でも冷やしてきたらどうだ？
冷静になって
自分の馬鹿な行いを見つめなおして来いよ！
column4:
—Why don't you go outside and cool 
your head a bit? 
Calm down and take a good look 
at your foolish actions!

column3:
――コイツの言うことも一理ある
覚者、一度諜報に出て、まだ行ってない場所や
戦ってない敵と戦うのも良いかもしないぞ
column4:
—There's some truth to what this guy is saying. 
Arisen, it might be a good idea to go out on a 
reconnaissance mission, explore places you 
haven't been to yet, 
and fight enemies you haven't faced.

column3:
そして他の《証拠》を例のメモと
じっくり見比べてみろ
――自ずと答えは見えるはずだぜ
column4:
Then, examine the other 
evidence closely against that memo. 
—The answer will come to light.

column3:
憲兵めが、自分の状況をわかっているのか？
その気になれば殺せるんだぞ！
column4:
The military police—
are they even aware of their predicament? 
I could end them whenever I choose!

column3:
フン――今さらそんな脅しが通じるか
捕まった失態は、貴様らの逮捕で
挽回してやるからな
column4:
Hmph—
do you really think those threats will 
scare me now? 
I'll redeem myself for getting captured 
by taking you down!

column3:
――あの無慈悲な侯爵が、こんな大失敗を
その程度の手柄で許すと思うか？
column4:
――Do you think the unforgiving marquis will 
let a failure this big slide for a simple 
accomplishment like that?

column3:
覚者、憲兵は市民に対し権力を持つ代わりに
非常に厳しく冷酷な戒律で縛られている
コイツにはまだ、その実感が無いんだ――
column4:
Arisen, 
the military police hold power over the citizens,
but they're also bound by cruel and strict rules.
This guy hasn't realized that yet.

column3:
その現実を知らしめるような《証拠》は無いか？
昔はよく、メガドの裏路地で
憲兵の悲惨な噂を聞いたもんだったが――
column4:
Do we have any kind of proof that could open his 
eyes to this reality? 
I recall hearing many dreadful tales about the 
military police in the alleys of Megado...

column3:
おい！
憲兵たちのやり方に何とも思わないのか！？
column4:
Hey!
Do you really have no problem with the way 
the military police operate!?

column3:
思わない――というより
思いたくても、思ってはいけないんだ
所属している限りはな
column4:
It's not that I don't care—
I'm not allowed to care, even if I wanted to.
As long as I'm one of them.

column3:
思ってしまえば、行動や見た目に滲み出る
脱走兵なんて――
そうなれば、手が及ぶのは俺だけでは済まない
column4:
If you let yourself think about it, 
it seeps into your actions and appearance. 
Once that happens, the repercussions won't be 
limited to just me.

column3:
ヤツは揺らいでいる――
誰かを心配しているのか？
column4:
He's wavering—
might he be anxious about someone?

column3:
覚者――メガドに思い当る人物はいないか？
誰かは分からんが
きっとその人物が鍵となるはずだ
column4:
Arisen—does anyone in Megado come to mind? 
I'm not sure who, 
but that person is likely the key.

column4: Do you want to debug it?

column3:
今まで何度も尋問は行ってきたが
さすがにオークは初めてだぜ
column4:
I've conducted interrogations many times before, 
but this is the first time with an orc.

column3:
とはいえ――やり方は今までと同じだ
今さら説明はいらないな？
column4:
Nonetheless — the method is the same as before
You don't need further explanation now, right?

column3:
それじゃ、早速始めるか
手始めに基本的な《話題》から聞いてみよう
column4:
Well, let's get started:
Let's start with a basic "topic" for starters.

column3: Ａ、メガドに来た目的
column4: A. Purpose of coming to Megado

column3: Ｂ、オーク自身について
column4: B. About the orc themselves.

column3: 《証拠》を確認する
column4: Check the "evidence"

column3: ――今日はやめる
column4: --I'm not doing this today.

column3:
裏切り者と思わしき人間とオークが共に居た
――これだけで限りなく決定的に近い
状況ではあるが、一応聞いてやる
column4:
The fact that a suspected traitor and an orc were 
together is almost conclusive, 
but I'll still give you a chance to explain.

column3: 一体あの場所で何をしていた？
column4: What the hell were you doing in that place?

column3: 何ヲシテイタカ？
column4: What were you up to?

column3:
フン――愚カナ人間メ
アノ死ンダ人間ニデモ、聞イテミロ！
column4:
Hmph—Stupid humans. 
Try asking that dead human!

column3:
おーくガ、人間ニ協力スルコトナド
火山ガ噴火シヨウガ、アリエナイ！
column4:
There's no way an orc would help humans, 
not even if a volcano erupted!

column3:
チッ――当然だが
簡単に答えてはくれないか
column4:
Tch—Of course, 
it won't be easy to get answers.

column3:
やはり、まずは証拠を手に入れてから
糸口を見つけていくしかないようだな――
column4:
It seems we'll need to gather evidence first 
and find a clue from there.

column3:
覚者、現場は調べてみたか？
証拠を見つけられるとしたら
最も可能性が高いのはあの場所だ
column4:
Arisen, have you investigated the scene? 
If we're going to find evidence, 
that place is the most likely spot.

column3:
もしまだ調べていないのなら
まずはこの事件が発生した現場を調べてみよう
column4:
If you haven't already checked it out,
let's try the site where this incident occurred.

column3:
おいおい――怖気づいたのか？
始まったばかりだぞ
column4:
Whoa now — are you scared?
We're just getting started.

column3:
ゲハハッ！　俺ガ怖イノカ？
オ前、本当ニアノ覚者カ？
column4:
Gehaha!　Are you afraid of me?
Are you really an Arisen?

column3:
ほら、オークにまで言われてるぞ
悔しくないのか？
column4:
Look, even an orc is saying it. 
Aren't you frustrated?

column3:
ここで安全に尋問できる時間は限られている――
出来る時に出来ることをやっておこう
column4:
We have a limited amount of time to safely 
interrogate them here--
Let's do what we can.

column3: お前自身のことを聞かせてもらおうか
column4: Let's hear about you.

column3:
俺ノコトダト？
フン――貴様ラ人間ニ、関係アルノカ？
column4:
You want to know about me? 
Hmph—what concern is that to you humans?

column3: それは、聞いてから俺たちが決めることだ
column4: That's for us to decide after we hear it.

column3: いつ頃からオーク軍に所属しているんだ？
column4: Since when have you been part of the Orc Army?

column3:
フン――貴様ラノ間抜ケナ王子ヲ
捻リ潰ス、ズット前カラサ
column4:
Hmph—
I've wanted to crush that useless prince 
of yours since long ago.

column3:
残念だったな、ネド王子は
貴様らオークを出し抜いてご健在なんだ
column4:
Too bad Prince Nedo is still alive and well after
outfoxing you orcs.

column3:
――ウガァァ！
今、生キテイヨウガ、死ンデイヨウガ
ソレハ小サナ違イダ！
column4:
—Ughhh! 
Alive or dead, 
it's a minor difference!

column3:
勝ツノハ、俺タチ！
人間ナド皆殺シダ！
column4:
We will win! 
We'll slaughter all humans!

column3:
そうかそうか――ところで、さっきより
ずいぶんと饒舌になったな？
column4:
Ok, ok - by the way, you're a lot more
talkative than you used to be, aren't you?

column3: 逃げるのも諦めて観念したのか？
column4:
Have you given up on escaping 
and resigned yourself?

column3:
観念ダト？　馬鹿メ！
おーくハ、絶対ニ！　人間ナドニ屈シナイ！
column4:
Resigned? Idiot! 
An orc never bows to humans!

column3:
ソシテ、今ニ貴様ラハ
後悔スルコトニナルダロウ！
column4: Soon,, you will regret it!

column3:
おーくノ軍ハ、スグニチカラヲ溜メテ戻ッテクル
ソシテ俺ヲ助ケ出シ、チッポケナ人間ドモヲ
マタ奴隷ニスルノダ
column4:
The orc army will gather its strength and return. 
They will rescue me and wipe out 
all you insignificant humans.

column3: ――随分と自信たっぷりだな
column4: -- You have a lot of confidence.

column3: フン――命乞イシテモ遅イ
column4: Hah— it's too late to beg for your life now.

column3:
かなり自信満々のようだが――
オーク1匹を助けるために満身創痍の
オーク軍が来ると、本当に思うか？
column4:
You seem quite confident, 
but do you really believe that the already 
beaten orc army would come all this way just 
to save a single orc?

column3:
オーク軍の情報を引き出すには
この鼻っ柱をへし折ってやるか――
column4:
To get the orc army's information, 
we might need to crush this arrogance.

column3:
あるいは、口を滑らしてしまうような
上機嫌にさせる《証拠》があると良いんだが――
column4:
Alternatively, it would be ideal to have some 
evidence that puts them in such a good mood 
that they might slip up.

column3:
フゥ――なるほど
オークとまともに対話するのは初めてだが
やはりスムーズにはいかないな
column4:
Huh... I see.
This is the first time I've had a 
proper conversation with an orc.

It's not exactly going smoothly.

column3:
しかも――どうやらコイツ
長い事オーク軍にいたらしいが
column4:
What's more... apparently this guy
has been in the Orc Army for a long time.

column3:
今まで戦死もせず、出世も
できていないところを見ると
口だけは立派な雑魚オークのようだな
column4:
Seeing as how he hasn't died in battle and hasn't 
been able to rise to the top,
he seems to be a small fry orc with a big mouth.

column3:
おい覚者、コイツどうしようか
始末するか？
column4:
Hey Arisen, what should we do with this guy? 
Should we get rid of him?

column3:
ウガァァァァァ！！
人間メ――コレ以上ノ侮辱ハ、許サンゾ！
column4:
Ugaaaaaa!! 
Humans— 
I won't tolerate any more of this humiliation!

column3:
なんだ、気に障ったか？ 
だが事実だろう
column4:
What, you don't like it? 
But it's true.

column3:
ウガァァァァ！！
伝令兵ハ生キ残リ
手紙ヲ届ケルコトガ仕事ダ！
column4:
Guhgaaaaaa!! 
The messenger is to stay alive 
and deliver the letter!

column3:
生キ長ラエ、軍ニ貢献シ続ケルコト
優秀デアル証ナノダ！
無知ナ人間メ、捻リ潰シテヤル！
column4:
Surviving and contributing to the army is 
evidence of superiority! 

I'll crush ignorant humans!

column3:
ほう――思いがけず重要な情報を
二つ得られたな
column4:
Ho—
We unexpectedly got two important pieces 
of information.

column3:
一つ目――どうやらオークはあえて怒らせたり
おだてたりするとよく喋るようだな
これからの尋問に役立ちそうだ
column4:
One, it seems that orcs tend to talk more when 
they are deliberately provoked or flattered. 
This might be useful for future interrogations.

column3:
それからもう一つ――
このオークは伝令兵として
メガドまではるばる文書を届けに来たんだ
column4:
Two; this orc came all the way to Megado 
as a messenger to deliver a document.

column3:
となると
<COL ff2600>届けに来たオークの文書が
事件現場のどこかにまだある可能性が高い</COL>
column4:
Then it's likely that the document delivered by 
the orc is 
<COL ff2600>still somewhere at the scene of the incident.</COL>

column3:
覚者、まずはそれを足がかりとして
諜報活動を始めていこう
column4:
Arisen, let's use that as a starting point and 
begin our intelligence activities.

column3:
来たな
さぁ、今日も始めようか
column4:
You're here.
OK, let's start today too.

column3: 本当に、今日の尋問はこれで終了にしていいんだな？
column4: Are you sure you want to call it quits on today's interrogation?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: ――今日はこのくらいにしてやるか
column4: Well, that's enough for today.

column3:
――ゲハハハッ！
愚カナ人間、頭オカシクナッタカ
column4:
-- Gehahaha!
Foolish humans, have you gone mad?

column3:
――その《証拠》を突きつけるのは
ここではなさそうだな
column4:
It seems that presenting that evidence isn't 
the right approach here.

column3:
脅してさらなる情報を引き出したり
諜報で新たな《証拠》を探すのもいい
――もう一度よく考えてみるんだ
column4:
You can threaten them to extract more information 
or search for new evidence using intelligence
— think about it again.

column3:
――本当にそう思うか？
もう一度、よく考え直してみたらどうだ？
column4:
--do you really think so?
Why don't you think again?

column3:
――グハハ！　愚カナ人間メ！
恐怖デ、頭オカシクナッタカ
column4:
-- Hahaha! You foolish humans! 
Have you gone mad from fear?

column3:
チッ、オークに舐められちまったみたいだな
――二度目はしっかりな？
column4:
Tch, it looks like the orc is 
treating us with contempt. 

-- Make sure not to let it happen a second time.

あと一歩だな――
よし、頼むぞ
column4:
We're just one step away—
Okay, I'll ask.

column4: A. Purpose of coming to Megado

column3: Ｂ、オーク自身について

column3: もう沢山だ！！
column4: Enough!

column3:
このままでは埒が明かない――
強硬手段が効かないか、実際に試させてもらう
覚者、悪いがこれにお前の意思は関係ない
column4:
If we continue like this, we'll get nowhere—
If strong measures don't work, 
I'll have to put them to the test myself.
Arisen, sorry, 
but your input isn't required for this.

column3:
少しあっちを向いていろ
お前に見せるには
少し刺激が強いからな――
column4:
Arisen, look away for a moment.
What I'm about to do is a bit too intense for 
you to see...

column3:
まったく、手こずらせやがって
明日はもう少し喋る気になるだろう――
column4:
You're a real hassle.
By tomorrow, you'll be more willing to talk.

column3:
さて――裏切り者と思わしき人間と
オークが共に居た
column4:
Now then—
The supposed traitor was seen with an orc.

column3:
これだけで限りなく決定的に
近い状況ではあるが、一応聞いてやる
column4:
With this alone, the situation is almost certainly 
conclusive, but I'll ask anyway.

column3: 一体あの場所で何をしようとしていた？
column4: What the hell were you trying to do in that place?

column3: 何ヲシテイタカ？
column4: What were you up to?

column3:
フン――愚カナ人間メ
アノ死ンダ人間ニデモ、聞イテミロ！
column4:
Hmph—Stupid humans. 
Try asking that dead human!

column3:
おーくガ、人間ニ降参スルコトナド
火山ガ噴火シヨウガアリエナイ！
column4:
There's no chance an orc would ever yield to 
humans, even if a volcano were to erupt!

column3:
チッ――
当然だが簡単に答えてはくれないか
column4:
Tch—Of course, 
it won't be easy to get answers.

column3:
覚者、まずは事件現場を調査して
《証拠》を手に入れよう
それを突きつけ、糸口にするんだ――
column4:
Arisen, begin by inspecting the scene
to find "evidence."
Use that to press for answers.

column3: 脅す
column4: Threaten

column3: 《証拠》を突きつける
column4: Present the evidence

column3: ――やめる
column4: -- Stop

column3:
どのような手を使ってでも協力してもらうぞ
まずは――この文書についてだ
column4:
No matter what methods I have to use, 
you'll cooperate. 

First, let's talk about this document.

column3: 顔色が変わったな
column4: I see your expression has shifted.

column3:
お前がメガドに訪れたのは
これを届けるためだな？
column4:
You came to Megado
to deliver this, right?

column3: ――――まぁいい
column4: ---- Well, okay.

column3:
この文書――オーク軍の暗号か何かだな
なんと書いてあるか、読み上げろ
column4:
This document--
it's some kind of Orc military code or something.

What does it say? Read it out loud.

column3: ――グハハ！
column4: --guhaha!

column3: ――オ前タチ、読メナインダロウ？
column4: --You can't read, can you?

column3:
読ンデヤル――ワケナイダロウガ！
愚カダナ！　貴様ラ、愚カダナ！
column4:
Read it — why would I!
Stupid fool! You're an idiot!

column3:
驚いたな――
俺たち、オークにコケにされてるぞ！
column4:
Unbelievable— 
we're getting ridiculed by an orc!

column3:
おい、いずれ分かることなんだ――
時間を稼いでも無駄だぞ
column4:
Hey, we'll find out sooner or later--
You're wasting your time.

column3: グハハ！　面白イ人間ドモダ
column4: Guhaha!　You're a funny human.

column3:
クソ、完全に舐められちまったようだな
――すまない
column4:
Shit, we've clearly been overcome. 
I apologize.

column3:
オークを動揺させるには
もっと決定的な証拠が必要だ
やはりこの文書を翻訳するしかないか――
column4:
To unsettle the orc, 
more decisive evidence is needed. 
Seems we must translate this document after all.

column3:
覚者、＜オーク軍の密通文書＞を翻訳する手段を
メガドで探してみよう
内容さえ分かったら、あとは突きつけてやるだけだ
column4:
Arisen, look for a method to translate the 
"Orc Army Secret Documents" in Megado. 

Once we know its contents, 
we can present it and take action.

column3: 脅す
column4: Threaten

column3: 《証拠》を突きつける
column4: Present the evidence

column4: -- Stop

column3:
バジットの時に世話になった<NPC 698>なら
何か知っているかもしれないな
column4:
If anyone might know something, 
it would be <NPC 698>, 
who helped us during the Basit situation.

column3: 待たせたな
column4: Sorry to keep you waiting.

column3:
手紙の内容は
"オーク軍は要請に応え、メガドに援軍を手配した"
という旨だった――間違いないな？
column4:
The content of the letter was to the effect that 
"The Orc army responded to the request and 
arranged reinforcements for Megado"

— there's no doubt about that?

column3:
問題は――
一体誰がオークの援軍を要請したか
column4:
The question is--
who on earth called for orc reinforcements?

column3:
その手がかりは、ナヴィドの執事である
エニスが握っていた――はずだったんだがな
column4:
The clue was - or should have been - 
held by Navid's butler,
Ennis.

column3: なぜ取引相手であるエニスを殺したんだ？
column4: Why did you kill Ennis, your business partner?

column3: ウグググ――
column4: Ugu Gu Gu...

column3: ――ウガァァ！
column4: --Ugaa!

column3:
アノ人間来タアト――
覚者、オ前ノ臭イガシタ！
column4:
After that human came—
Arisen, I smelled your stink!

column3:
アノ人間ガ、おーく軍ヲ裏切リ、覚者ト組ンデ
俺ヲ殺ソウトシタ――ダカラ殺シタ
column4:
That human betrayed the orc army and teamed up 
with the Arisen to kill me—so I killed them.

column3: それは――
column4: That is...

column3:
グルル！
おーくハ！　裏切リヲ！　許サナイ！
column4:
Grrr! 
Orcs! Never! Forgive traitors!

column3:
誤解だった――と言っても今更意味はない
それよりも、この証言を
何かに活かせないか考えよう
column4:
There's no point in 
saying it was a misunderstanding —

Rather than that,
let's think about whether this testimony 
can be used in something

column3: オークは裏切りを許さない――か
column4:
Orcs are unforgiving when it 
comes to betrayal, huh...

column3:
取引相手すら手にかけるほど
激昂するとはな
その特性――何かに利用できるかもな
column4:
He was so enraged, he killed his own ally. 
That kind of temper... 
it might be something we can exploit.

column3:
現場を調べたら見つかったこの密通文書――
メガドの通称 "ガクシャ" に訳してもらったら
こんなことが書いてあった
column4:
The clandestine document found during 
the investigation—
when translated by the "Scholar" of Megado, 
it turned out to say this.

column3:
"オーク軍はメガドに援軍を手配した"
要請したのは、一体誰なのか――
column4:
"The Orc Army has arranged 
reinforcements for Megado"
Who exactly requested it ――

column3:
だが、それを知っている<NPC 586>は殺された
"覚者の臭いがしたから、裏切られたと思った"
――という動機らしい
column4:
The person who knew about it, 
<NPC 586>, was killed. 
The motive appears to be that 
"they smelled the scent of the Arisen and 
thought they had been betrayed."

column3:
オークは裏切りを絶対に許さない――
この特性は利用できるかもしれないぞ
覚えておこう
column4:
Orcs never forgive betrayal --
You might be able to use this characteristic.
Let's keep that in mind.

column3: お前自身のことを聞かせてもらおうか
column4: Let's hear about you.

column4: Since when have you been part of the Orc Army?
